widgets_values: Sdxl/test

nodes.title: Load Image
widgets_values:
This is where you load your **input image** for editing.  
- Click the node and press **`Ctrl + V`** to paste  
- Or drag an image straight from **Google or your files** into it

nodes.title: VAE Encode
widgets_values:
Just like **VAE Decode** turns AI-generated data into a visible image, **VAE Encode** does the reverse.

It **encodes a real image into latent space**, so the **UNet** can alter it.

You **always** need this node for image to image.

nodes.title: Image Comparer (rgthree)
widgets_values:
A visual comparison node that shows **image_a** by default, and reveals **image_b** when you hover for the slide effect.

- You can use this instead of **Preview Image** instead. Or add this one to **image-to-image**

To **copy or save an image**, right-click on the side showing the image you want which depends on order of inputs. In this case:  
- Right of the node = processed version  
- Left = original  
If the right-click doesn't behave as expected, try **updating rgthree nodes** in the Manager‚Äîor just switch to **Preview** or **Save Image**.

nodes.title: KSampler
widgets_values:
Here the **denoise** value becomes your strength slider for **change**.

- **0.5** some change, good starting point
- Raise to 0.70 (for example) if not enough change  
- Lower it if you want less change

nodes.title: Fast Groups Bypasser
widgets_values:
When you first add this node, it will auto-detect **all groups**.  
To make it only apply to a **specific group**:

1. Right-click the node  
2. Open the **Properties Panel**  
3. In the **"matchtitle"** box, type the **exact name of the group** you want it to match

nodes.title: VAE Decode
widgets_values:
Think of this as the final translator:

CLIP encodes your prompt  
UNet builds the image in latent space (math/numbers)  
**VAE Decode** turns that into pixels you can see

It can also work in reverse. See **Image-to-Image**.

P.S: Markdown Note nodes won't stay grey and revert back to their default yellowish color. The others that look grey are in fact black.

nodes.type: Image Scale To Total Pixels (SDXL Safe)

properties.Node name for S&R: Image Scale To Total Pixels (SDXL Safe)

widgets_values: nearest-exact
MiaoshouAI/Florence-2-large-PromptGen-v2.0
fp16
sdpa
caption
randomize

nodes.title: Florence2Run
widgets_values:
This node handles the **text generation task**. Here are the most important options:

1. **caption** ‚Äì Short, natural-sounding description  
2. **detailed_caption** ‚Äì Longer than caption  
3. **more_detailed_caption** ‚Äì Even longer  
4. **prompt_gen_tags** ‚Äì Outputs tag-style prompts like `1girl, pose, environment` instead of natural sentences

**caption** is the best default for most workflows.

---

**max_new_tokens:**  
Controls the **length** of the generated text. Depends on the **task** selected:

- For **caption**, **detailed_caption**, and **more_detailed_caption**: keep at default (`1024`) or lower if needed
- For **prompt_gen_tags**: reduce to around **50** (already preset)

You can tweak the other settings if you‚Äôre curious, but the **defaults are already tuned** for most use cases.

nodes.title: DownloadAndLoadFlorence2Model
widgets_values:
This node auto-downloads your selected model.  
üïê You‚Äôll need to wait for the download to finish before using ComfyUI again.

The differences between models aren‚Äôt super significant. I‚Äôve pre-selected a **good choice (last in the list)** to simplify it.

nodes.title: Load Upscale Model
widgets_values:
The model you load here determines the **amount upscaled** typically **x2, x4, or x8**.  
Each model is trained to upscale by a specific amount, so the **Upscale Image (using Model)** node automatically applies the correct scaling.

nodes.title: Scale Image to Total Pixels
widgets_values:
SDXL works best around **1 megapixel.**  
That‚Äôs why the **SDXL Empty Latent Image** node uses fixed resolutions. Random sizes can cause extra heads, torsos, and traumatize you ü•≤

This node **scales** oversized or tiny images to closer to SDXL-safe dimensions** (not perfect), but **skips scaling** if the image already matches any resolution from the **SDXL Empty Latent Image** node.  
That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs a **custom node**. I had to edit the default.

nodes.title: Reroutes
widgets_values: Wires have a dots in the middle. Click that, add reroute.

nodes.title: Label (rgthree)
widgets_values:
The giant titles are "Label (rgthree)" nodes. Add one. Double click it to open the properties panel. You can add a title of course but as well as font size or color. 

You can just type common color names in or use hex's like "#9c0c02" is red. Search "hex color" on google and it should pop up an easy way to get them for your desired color.

nodes.title: Groups
widgets_values:
To create a group:  
- Select nodes using **Ctrl + **click and drag** to box select  
- Press **Ctrl + G** to group them

To change the **group color** beyond the presets:
- Right-click the group  
- Scroll to **"Edit Group" ‚Üí "Colors" ‚Üí "Custom"** and choose your own

You can also right-click a group and select **"Fit to Nodes"** to resize it cleanly.

nodes.title: Fast Groups Bypasser
widgets_values:
When you first add this node, it will auto-detect **all groups**.  
To make it only apply to a **specific group**:

1. Right-click the node  
2. Open the **Properties Panel**  
3. In the **"matchtitle"** box, type the **exact name of the group** you want it to match

nodes.title: Final Tips (Optional Read)
widgets_values:
**üõ†Ô∏è Node Groups & Renaming Tips**

Creating **node groups** (select multiple, right-click ‚Üí Convert to Node Group) can help keep things tidy when building your own workflows.  
However, when **sharing workflows**, groups used to cause issues (maybe fixed now), and they can still confuse people especially beginners.

---

**Node Renaming**

I renamed nodes in **v1**, but started undoing that before release and won‚Äôt be doing it again, even for myself.

Why? Renaming nodes can cause confusion:
- Makes it harder for others to find the original node
- Breaks searchability (e.g. this is a **"markdown note"** node, renaming it hides that)

üí° Right-click a node to see its **real name** (like this one) at the top of the popup box.

---

**v1 vs v1.5 ‚Äì Which Style Is Better?**

This version isn‚Äôt automatically better than **v1**. It depends on the user:

- If you want to **learn ComfyUI** and understand what‚Äôs going on, **v1.5 is for you**.
- If you just want to **plug and play**, **v1 might be faster**.

Let me know in the **Patreon comments** which one worked better for you if you used both.

---

**ü§ñ About Noodletron**

I personally liked making Noodletron. I didn't use him here because his instructions were: "explain only what you need to, offload everything else to google, assume the user laughs at your jokes, and use emojis like your life depends on it"

I genuinely do not know what people thought of him üòÖ

---
Level 2 is waiting üöÄ
---

---

nodes.title: Prompt from Image
widgets_values:
---

### Generate a prompt from an image automatically

---

1. Load an image and hit **Run**  
2. A prompt will be generated from the image  
3. You can edit or refine the output if needed

---

nodes.title: Simple Upscale
widgets_values:
---

### Upscale an image fast

---

1. Load your image and choose an upscale model (e.g. `x2` to double size)  
2. Hit **Run** ‚Üí That‚Äôs it

*Use Advanced Upscale for better results especially with 4x*

---

nodes.title: Image-to-Image
widgets_values:
---

### Use an image as a starting point for generation

---

1. Load an image and write your prompt  
2. Hit **Run** ‚Üí Raise denoise strength if image did not change enough

---

nodes.title: üìå Must Read First (You'll Live)
widgets_values:
---
First-time users
--- 
If completely new to ComfyUI and not coming from another UI, consider **doing v1 workflows first** (on Patreon, easy to find). They were made exactly for you. These will be waiting for you when you want them.

---
Teach ComfyUI
---
v1.5 is designed to **teach you ComfyUI**.

Clean layout. No collapsed nodes (except notes). Only *necessary* custom nodes. Reroutes for clarity. Left-to-right logic. v1 = just use it. v1.5 = learn it.

---
**Wire Style Recommendation**:
---
Use the **default wire link type** (spline), not **"straight"**.

- If you changed it: go to settings (bottom left), search for "link render mode", change to spline.
- Straight wires look tidy, but make it harder to trace wires in messy workflows. 
---
**Must Know Tips**
---

- To see previews as images are made: **Manager ‚Üí Preview Method ‚Üí Auto**
- To **collapse or expand a node**, click the **gray dot** in its top-left corner
- **Double-click empty space** to open the **node search** bar
- To **change node colors**, click the node and use popup top bar  
- For more options: **Right-click ‚Üí Colors ‚Üí Custom** (**eyedropper** tool lives here)

---
How To Use  
---
Each group starts with a **‚ÄúHow To Use‚Äù** note. This is the **minimum** you need to get a result. For deeper understanding and tips, check the **Cheat Sheet** section.

---
Last But Not Least:
---
Huge thanks to **Power Users üí™**. If you subscribed, I saw. **I appreciate you.** Huge motivation to keep going. ü´°

nodes.title: Text-to-Image Prompting
widgets_values:
---

### Prompt to generate an image from scratch

---

1. Load a checkpoint you actually have (or you will get an error)
2. Type your *positive prompt* in the green `CLIP Text Encode (Prompt)` node  
3. Type your *negative prompt* in the red one  
4. Hit **Run** ‚Üí That‚Äôs it

---
Hyper3d.safetensors
increment
dpmpp_2m_sde_gpu
karras

nodes.title: Preview/Save Image
widgets_values:
Above this is a **Save Image** node, but I almost always use **Preview Image** instead to avoid saving every generation.

When you increase the **"run"** number to generate multiple outputs, use **Save Image** so each run saves individually, instead of overwriting the preview.

üóÇÔ∏è Use file_prefix in Save Image to organize outputs:

Example: sdxl/test will create a sdxl folder in your outputs folder and save images as test_0001, test_0002, etc.

üîé Final Tip:  
You don‚Äôt need to stretch the Preview Image node to see ‚Äúmore pixels.‚Äù  
Zoomed in to a small image or zoomed out to a big image, displays the same pixels on screen.  
Instead, size this node for **workflow cleanliness** or to reduce scrolling when going from prompt to preview over and over.

nodes.title: Groups
widgets_values:
To create a group:  
- Select nodes using **Ctrl + **click and drag** to box select  
- Press **Ctrl + G** to group them

To change the **group color** beyond the presets:
- Right-click the group  
- Scroll to **"Edit Group" ‚Üí "Colors" ‚Üí "Custom"** and choose your own

You can also right-click a group and select **"Fit to Nodes"** to resize it cleanly.

nodes.title: Load Checkpoint
widgets_values:
‚ö†Ô∏è If this node is looking for a file you don't have, you will get an error with phrases like:

**Prompt execution failed**  
**Value not in list**

This is **extremely common** for loading workflows where the creator has different files names.

nodes.title: Power Lora Loader (rgthree)
widgets_values:
LoRAs add extra knowledge to your checkpoint, usually **style** or **characters**.  
üëâ Download LoRAs from [Civitai](https://civitai.com), then follow the creator's **trigger words** and **recommended settings** in the descriptions.

I used **Power Lora Loader** instead of the default **Load LoRA** so you can use **multiple LoRAs at once** without chaining them (and ruining the clean workflow üòî).

nodes.title: CLIP Text Encode (Prompt)
widgets_values: This node uses the clip model to convert your **text prompt** into something the **UNet** (the model) can understand.

nodes.title: Sdxl Empty Latent Image
widgets_values:
A Maxed Out custom version of the default **Empty Latent Image**, made to avoid manually typing resolution. Every. Single. Time. The resolutions are all the ones SDXL can and should do.

**Batch Size:** How many images to make at once (more = more VRAM)

üí° Pro Tip: Want to run multiple generations in one click?  
Increase the number next to **"run"** or **"queue"**. Instead of smashing run 5 times, just set it to 5. You‚Äôll see a queue number top left.

nodes.title: KSampler üë¥üëì
widgets_values:
**Seed:** Adds randomness. Same prompt + settings = same image unless you change the seed.

---

**Control Before/After Generate:** Controls seed so you don't have to manually.  
1. **Increment** works well to quickly get back to a seed if you like the image
2. If on **"fixed"** and you make an image but change nothing else, ComfyUI won't make the same image twice in a row and will seem unresponsive when hitting run. Keep that in mind before you smash your keyboard wondering why ComfyUI won't listen üôÇ

---

**Steps:**  Steps are mostly the same for all SDXL finetunes or merges
1. Keep this at **30**  
2. Less can work (**20**, **25**)  
3. More gives diminishing returns

---

**CFG:** Controls how strongly your prompt is followed. Also affects how the image looks:  
1. Low = dull, high = overbaked  
2. 4‚Äì8 range is pretty good  
3. If your image has artifacts (like solid color 2D shapes), lower CFG

---

**Sampler + Scheduler:** These work together.  
1. I recommend: **dpmpp_2m_sde_gpu + karras**  
2. Faster alternative: **euler_ancestral + karras** (smoother textures, can be good)  
3. Some combos work better on certain checkpoints. Check Civitai descriptions.

---

**Denoise:**  
1. For text-to-image, keep this at **1.00**  
2. See **Image-to-Image** for when to change it
